===This page shows how to browse the DDI ontology from a web browser, such IE,firefox,Safari,etc. We are currently working on an embeded browser which provide a easier and more friendly interface. It will come soon.===

==== There are four steps to browse DDI: ====

 # Go to OwlSight website http://pellet.owldl.com/ontology-browser/ and click the big green 'Launch OwlSight' button.[http://ddiontology.co.cc/wiki/images/8/8b/Ldi_browser_step1.jpg]
 # After clicking, a new window will pop up like the figure below. Click the 'File' on the menu bar and select 'Load Ontology...'.[http://ddiontology.co.cc/wiki/images/2/27/Ldi_browser_step2.jpg]
 # In the pop up dialogue box, input DDI URI 'http://users.aber.ac.uk/ddq/ddi.owl ' into the 'Ontology URI' textfield. Uncheck the box before 'Use Cached Copy (if possible)'. Then click 'Browse' button.[http://ddiontology.co.cc/wiki/images/a/a1/Ddi_browser_step3.jpg]]
 # Now you can browse DDI freely. [http://ddiontology.co.cc/wiki/images/f/fa/Ddi_browser_step4.jpg]
 # You can also download 'ddi.owl' and open it with any OWL editor, such as [http://protege.stanford.edu Protege].
